RockPy.Functions packageÂ¶

SubmodulesÂ¶

RockPy.Functions.convert moduleÂ¶

RockPy.Functions.convert.conversion(unit)Â¶

This is a conversion table. Ask for the unit like: conversion[‘mass’] returns the appropriate conversion factor

Parameters:unit – str
RockPy.Functions.convert.convert2(in_unit, out_unit, unit_type)Â¶
Parameters:
  • in_unit – str the input unit
  • out_unit – str the desired output unit
  • unit_type – what kind of units they are.
Returns:

conversion factor
Example:

assume you want to convert a samples mass from mg to kg

sample_mass = 0.00345  # sample weight in kg

sample_mass *= convert2('kg', 'mg', 'mass')  # gives new mass in mg

>> sample_mass = 3450.0
Implemented units:
 
  • ‘volume’ [only metric units]
  • ‘pressure’
  • ‘length’ [only metric units]
  • ‘mass’ [only metric units]
  • ‘area’ [only metric units]

RockPy.Functions.general.create_logger(name)Â¶
RockPy.Functions.general.differentiate(data_list, diff=1, smoothing=1, norm=False, check=False)Â¶

caclulates a smoothed (if smoothing > 1) derivative of the data

Parameters:
  • data_list – ndarray - 2D array with xy[:,0] = x_data, xy[:,1] = y_data
  • diff – int - the derivative to be calculated f’ -> diff=1; f’’ -> diff=2 default = 1
  • smoothing – int - smoothing factor
  • norm –
  • check –
Returns:
